title: Which explains why MP of MgO is higher than NaF

content.description: The melting point of MgO is higher than that of NaF. Explanations for this observation include which of the following?
content.question: I. Mg2+ is more positively charged than Na+. II. O2- is more negatively charged than F-. III. The O2- ion is smaller than the F- ion.

skill.text: 4.C: Explain the connection between particulate-level and macroscopic properties of a substance using models and representations.
